chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason S Haugen was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: to any sentence being served in Dunn County case number 10CF136.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must maintain absolute sobriety. May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason S Haugen in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Jason S Haugen in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:06 Case called. State makes correction to PSI. Argument by State. Argument by Attorney Hinde. Defendant relates. Court relates and orders:

OWI 9th Offense - .180 BAC

Total length of sentence 8 years
3 years Initial Confinement
5 years Extended Supervision
Concurrent to any sentence serving in Dunn County Case No. 10CF136
Credit for 166 days
Is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions:
$600 fine plus costs and surcharges
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
36 month DL revocation
36 month ignition interlock
AODA and follow through with driver safety plan
120 hours of Community Service
Must maintain absolute sobriety
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold

Voting rights and firearm warning given. WEDS given.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must give sample today.

Defendant Jason S Haugen in court with attorney Ryan Raymond for today.  Defendant Jason S Haugen in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond relates.  State relates.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1 OWI 9th offense.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 are Dismissed and Read In.  15TR1833, 15TR1834 and 15TR1835 are Dismissed and Read In.  Court orders PSI.  Bond revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jason S Haugen in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Jason S Haugen in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CF377, 156TR1835, 15TR1834 AND 15TR1833

15CF377:  
Defendant pleads NG to all three counts.

All above cases set for 11/11/15 at 2:00
Bond to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jason S Haugen in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Jason S Haugen in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3:03: Officer Jon Fick with the Chetek Police Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 3:08: Cross by Defense. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle at all.

Defendant Jason S Haugen in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Jason S Haugen in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
